title: SARS-CoV-2 Illumina MiSeq protocol v.1

source.description:
Mix the following components:
Component Volume
50 µM random hexamers
10mM dNTPs mix (10mM each)
Total Mastermix volume
(template RNA)
Total reaction volume
Prepare mastermix (1:1) of Random hexamers and dNTP:
Mix gently by pipetting up and down and pulse centrifuge to collect liquid at the bottom of the mastermix tube.

source.body: The mastermix should be prepared in a clean room and the nucleic acids added in a BSC or workbench exclusive for RNA work.

source.description:
Aliquot
of this mix into each well of a 96 well plate. Keep the plate in a cold block.

Use multichannel pippet to aliquot
of RNA to the plate from step 2, mix up and down 5x by multichannel pippette, briefly centrifuge the plate to collect the liquid at bottom of the wells.

Incubate the reaction mix in thermocycler as follows:
Hold

Prepare the following mastermix:
Component Volume
SSIV Buffer
100mM DTT
RNaseOUT RNase Inhibitor
SSIV Reverse Transcriptase
Total Mastermix volume
(denatured RNA)
Total reaction volume
Add
of mastermix to the denatured RNA from the previous step. Mix gently by pipetting up and down and briefly centrifuge to collect liquid at the bottom of the well.

source.body: The mastermix should be prepared in in a clean room and added to the denatured RNA in a BSC or workbench exclusive for RNA work.

source.description:
Perform reverse transcription reaction in thermocycler as follows:
Hold

Prepare the multiplex PCR reactions as follows and aliquot in each well of a 96-well plate x2 (1 for each pool):
Component Pool 1 Pool 2
5X Q5 Reaction Buffer
10 mM dNTPs
Q5 Hot Start DNA Polymerase
Primer Pool 1 or 2 (10µM)
Nuclease-free water
Total Mastermix volume
(cDNA)
Total reaction volume
Prealiquot
of each mastermix(pool1 and pool2) to each plate (pool1 and pool2) accordingly.

In a BSC or workbench exclusive for RNA work, add
of cDNA from step 6 to each plate and mix well by pipetting up and down. Seal the plates and briefly centrifuge to collect liquid at the bottom of the wells.

Run the 3.5 hours PCR program for each pool:
Step Temperature Time Cycles
Heat Activation
1
Denaturation
35
Annealing
35
Hold
1
Remove plates Pool 1 and Pool 2 amplicons from thermocyclers, briefly centrifuge.
Prepare large 1% agarose gels with TBE buffer with enough wells for each PCR product and a ladder on each row.

Mix
of 6X loading dye with
of PCR product and load gels with Pool 1 amplicons leaving a space between each sample to be filled by Pool 2 amplicons so that each sample can be visualized for both pools. Add 100bp ladder to left- and right-most wells.
Confirm that presence/absence of bands in gels correlate RT-PCR Ct values for each sample (e.g. if band is absent, does sample have E-gene Ct >30?). Band sizes should be approximately 400bp.
Run gels electrophoresis at 140V for

Combine the two pools of amplicons into one:
Add
of each Pool 1 and Pool 2 (total 25μl) in an 0.2 ml PCR plate (low binding plate).

Add
of AMPure XP beads(at
) to the combined amplicons plate. Mix by pippetting up and down 10x, briefly centrifugre, and incubate for
.

Based on the amplicon concentration, normalize of all the samples amplicon concentration to
.
This can be done by adding
of diluted amplicon to a plate with prealiquoted and appropriate amount of nuclease free water.

Thaw the following Nextera XT reagents on ice:
Amplicon tagment mix (ATM)
Tagment DNA buffer (TD)
Nextera PCR master mix (NPM)
Thaw the index primers, mix by vortex each vial and spin down the liquid at the bottowm of the vials.
Neutralization buffer (NT) at

Add the following reagents in order:
of TD buffer
of
amplicon
of ATM
Mix by pipetting up and down for 5 times.

Seal plate and briefly centrifuge. Incubate in thermocycler with the following steps:
hold

Remove the plate immediately once thermocycler reachs
, and proceed to neutralization.
Add
of NT buffer to each well and mix by pipetting up and down for 3 times, briefly spin down the plate and incubate at
for
.

Place the i5 and i7 index primers on the Illumina Index Adapter plate accordingly,
Add
of NPM to each wells and mix by pipetting up and down for 3 times.
Add
each of i5 and i7 index primers to each samples accordingly and mix by pipetting up and down for 5 times.
Seal plate and briefly centrifuge.

Run the 1 hour PCR program to amplify the libraries:
Step Temperature Time Cycles
1
1
2
1
3
13
3
13
3
13
4
1
5
Hold 1

Briefly spin the plate to collect liquid at the bottom of the wells.
Repeat the same clean up process as step 16 using
of AMPure XP beads and
of resuspension buffer (step 16.8).

Verify fragment size using Agilent D5000 Assay on TapeStation 4200.
Using library concentration and fragment size, calculate the molarity of the libraries using the following formula:
Molarity = concentration ng/uL * (1515.1515/fragment size(bp))

Normalize all the libraries to
by dilution with nuclease free water.

Denature the pooled libraries by mixing
of pooled libraries and
of freshly made 0.2N NaOH solution.
Incubate for
.

Add
of HT1 buffer and mix well with denatured pooled library by pipetting up and down 10 times with P1000.
Further dilute the pool library down to
with HT1 buffer to prevent over clusering, if the HS D1000 tape station concentration of the library shows greater than 4nM.

Load
of the denatured, diluted pooled library into the loading position of the Illumina reagent cartridge (V2, 300 cycle kit). Load reagent cartridge, flow cell, and PR2 buffer into Miseq instrument, confirm the metrics and start the run.

Place the plate on a magnetic rack for
, or until the beads have pelleted and the supernatant is completely clear.
Remove and discard the liquid from each well with a multichannel pippette.

Add
of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to each well, incubate for
, remove the ethanol carefully with a multichannel pippette.
Repeat ethanol wash (Step 16.3).
Remove the residual ethanol with a P20 multichannel pippette, allow plate to dry for 3-5 minutes on the magnetic rack or until the pellet loses its shine (do not over-dry the pellet).

Remove from magnetic rack, add
of EB buffer to wells and mix thoroughly by multichannel pippetting, until beads are resuspended. Briefly centrifuge the plate to collect the liquid at the bottom of the wells. Incubate at
for
.

Place the plate on magnetic rack and incubate for
to
or until the beads have pelleted and the supernatant is completely clear.

Transfer
of the clear supernatant to a new plate, ensuring no beads are transferred.
Quantify amplicons using Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity and DTX880 plate reader.

Create Qubit dsDNA HS working solution by mixing
buffer and
dye (X is the total number of samples, including 6 standards). Using a reservoir and multichannel pipette, dispense
into required number of wells of a Costar 3590 flat-bottom plate.

Dilute the amplicon (from step 16.8) 1:10 by mixing
of the amplicon in
of nuclease free water.

Make up serial standards using 1:2 dilutions of 10 ng/ul stock (Standard 2) from the Qubit HS. This creates 5 standards in the following concentrations:
plus Standard 1
.

Mix
of diluted amplicons and each of the 6 standards
of Qubit HS working solution, mix and breifly centrifuge. Use DTX880 plate reader to obtain reading for each sample and standards. The Qubit standard curve is generated by the Qubit standards.
Repeat the same quantification process as Step 17 but do NOT dilute libraries.

Pool
from each of the normalized libraries into a signal
microtube.
Measure the final pool concentration in duplicate using HS D1000 tape station.

description: ARTIC amplicon sequencing protocol adapted from Josh Quick's https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-v2-bdp7i5rn for illumina sequencing of SARS-CoV-2
